title: Keen Dreams
content:
Has anyone ever heard of two versions of Keen Dreams existing? I always believed there was only one, but now I'm talking to a guy who's got the 'rare registered version', as opposed to the easily available shareware...as soon as I can get a him to send me a copy without a virus I'll have a look.----------------------
Support (at least partially) for 27 games!
Check out the progress of Wombat Game Tools [url=http://student.ci.qut.edu.au/~n4738667/index.php?section=wombatwip]here[/url]

title: Re: Keen Dreams
content: There is two versions. The 'rare' one has a different intro screen and a slightly longer ending story. Not sure if anything else is different.

title: Re: Keen Dreams
content: Wasn't there three versions? Or just two..You hear in your mind: GAAARRRRRGG!

title: Re: Keen Dreams
content:
Sorry, but there's nothing different in the way of levels. It's just the title screen, none of that 'type START to play' and a bit longer ending story.

Interestingly, my copy of the .exe file is named KEEN7.exe. Is anyone elses registered version called this?

title: Re: Keen Dreams
content: That's wierd, I bought the registered version 1.17b from the Softdisk download store and the game content is the same as the shareware version.  The title screen is the same and the ending isn't different.  I'm using the shareware version from www.dosgames.com btw.-Mingy Jongo: Crafty Shaman Impersonator

title: Re: Keen Dreams
content: Haven't checked what www.dosgames.com's version of Keen Dreams is, but if it's the shareware one, then I'm afraid you may have been swindled by perhaps Softdisk. The registered version's title screen is distinctly different. The story, not so much, but does mention a possible Keen Dreams sequel - Keen meets the meats. Or perhaps Dosgames.com has the registered version up for download... I shall investigate [img]http://www.classicgaming.com/cc314/msgboard/emotikeen-disguised.gif[/img] [url=http://spikenexus.toxicsheep.com/pccw/][img]http://spikenexus.toxicsheep.com/pccw/imgs/links/pccwsml.gif[/img][/url]

title: Re: Keen Dreams
content: Well, the dosgames.com version doesn't mention Keen Meats the Meats, or have a distinctive title screen, and neither does the version I bought from Softdisk.  The only thing different is that if you type start at the command prompt it gives you a selection of whether you want to play or read some manuals.  Although it does have a nice single exe installer, which is a plus, but if I had know there was no other changes, I wouldn't have bought it for $10.  Maybe for $5, though.-Mingy Jongo: Crafty Shaman Impersonator

title: Re: Keen Dreams
content:
[quote]Quote:[hr]MJ: ...only thing different is that if you type start at the command prompt it gives you a selection of whether you want to play or read some manuals.[hr][/quote]
The registered version doesn't have that "Start" bit. Well, my copy doesn't at least. My copy loads in much the same way as 4-6. Look out from an email from me... explaining in more detail...[url=http://spikenexus.toxicsheep.com/pccw/][img]http://spikenexus.toxicsheep.com/pccw/imgs/links/pccwsml.gif[/img][/url]
